intro: Quillaja molinae, commonly known as the Molina's quillaja, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Hippocastanaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant is known for its bark, which contains saponins and has been used in traditional medicine. Quillaja molinae typically grows in moist, temperate forests and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
